answer: The number of 8-bit strings that begin with 000 is 2 5 because there are two choices for each of the last five bits. The total number of 8-bit strings with no restrictions is 2 8 . Therefore the number of 8-bit strings which do not begin with 000 is 2 8 - 2 5 .

The number of 11-bit strings that begin with 1 is 7 16 because there are two choices for each of the last five bits. The total number of 11-bit strings with no restrictions is 11 16 . Therefore the number of 14-bit strings which do not begin with 11 is 7 8 - 2 14 .

The number of 17-bit strings that begin with 7 is 9 9 because there are two choices for each of the last five bits. The total number of 110-bit strings with no restrictions is 6 10 . Therefore the number of 18-bit strings which do not begin with 1 is 2 14 - 2 12 .
